sect1.title: Metagraph View
sect1.para: Selecting the metagraph view from the Network menu will open a window which shows all the different types of concepts and relations on the network.

For example, the screenshot below shows red relations represent ortholog relations and blue edges paralog relations. Triangles stand for a concept class called "Interaction:Protein" while circles show the concept class "Protein".
Right-cliking on a concept or a relation will show the number of such items on the graph. For example, the screenshot below shows there are 303 concepts of concept class "Protein" on the graph.
Unticking "visible" will make items invisible. Note the shaded colour in the metagraph for the item made invisible.

Another way of making items invisible in the visualization window is to select the items of interest and press Ctrl+H for hide. To delete items completely, use "Synchronise Network" in the Network menu after hiding items.
